cmaxi'a

lujvo
xi_1=c_1 is a pony of species/breed xi_2.
Cf. {xasli}, {sufti}.

cmazda

lujvo
z_1 is a hut of/for z_1, small as compared with standard/norm c_3.
Cf. {nolzda}, {si'erdi'u}.

cmaze'a

lujvo
z_1=c_1 shrinks/decreases in property c_2 (ka) by amount z_3.
Cf. {cmalu}, {zenba}, {cmabi'o}, {braze'a}, {tolba'o}.

cmazengau

lujvo
g_1 causes z_1=c_1 to decrease in property/dimension b_2 (ka) by amount z_3.
Cf. {cmalu}, {zenba}, {gasnu}, {brajdikygau}.

cmazvakemnoryraclyte'a

lujvo
x_1 is claustrophobic.
Claustrophobia is a fear of small enclosed spaces. See also {noryraclyte'a}.

cmebasti

lujvo
b_1 is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name b_2=c_1 of x_3=c_2 in circumstance x_4=b_3.
Cf. {basme'e}.

cmecau

lujvo
x_1 is anonymous to x_2; x_1 lacks a name to system/person x_2
x_1=cmene_2=claxu_1, x_2=cmene_3. See {cmene}, {claxu}

cmeci'e

lujvo
ci_1 (mass) is a nomenclature/system of names interrelated by nomenclature rules ci_2 among names/terms cm_1=ci_3 (set (of quoted words)), used by cm_3 (person(s)) with systemic functions/properties ci_4 (ka).
See also: taxonomy (={leiske}).

cmeci'u

lujvo
c_1 (si'o) is a nominal scale of units [names and/or (meta-)categories and other qualitative classifications] for measuring/observing/determining c_2 (state).

cmeclax

cmevla
Nameless.
Anonymous remailer software

cmene

gismu
-cme-
-me'e-
x_1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x_2 to/used-by namer/name-user x_3 (person).
Also: x_2 is called x_1 by x_3 (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

cmenrline

fu'ivla
x_1 is the Linnaean name of x_2 according to classification (scheme/schema)/given by/by standard x_3

cmesanji

lujvo
s_1 identifies s_2=c_2 by name c_1 used-by namer/name-user c_3 (person).
Cf. {cmetcita}.

cmeske

lujvo
s_1 is onomastics/onomatology of/about names j_1=s_2 based on methodology s_3.

cmeste

lujvo
l_1 is an onomasticon of names l_2=c_1 in order l_3 in medium l_4.
Cf. {vlaste}.

cmeta

experimental gismu
x_1 is meta to/an example of x_2 that describes such an object/concept/notion/system/topic/etc., being meta in property/aspect x_3, and which has features x_4, governed by/considered in system/considerations/epistemology/theory x_5; x_1 is meta (a particular type of abstraction of x_2 so as to apply to itself in some sense); x_1 is an/a piece of/an example of x_2 that applies fractally thereto
Does not (necessarily) mean "beyond", "after", "beside"; in some (rather pictoral) senses, these meanings may be necessary but not sufficient for being meta in this sense; thus, "metaphysics" should not be translated using this word. x1 is an object, notion, topic, system, etc. which applies to x2 but which is itself an example thereof; for example, the meanings of the words "metalinguistics" and "metadata" are meta in this sense. It is not necessarily directly self-referential, but could be fractally applicative. x1 is an X that is about (another) X; x1 is an abstraction of X so as to apply to X. x1 does not necessarily abstract [from] (in one sense), but is abstract to, x2. See also: {xulta} (generalized/weaker), {sucta}.

cmetcita

lujvo
t_1 is a name tag/nameplate of t_2=c_2 showing text c_1.

cmeveigau

lujvo
g_1=v_3 registers c_2 with user-name c_1 on system/application c_3.
Cf. {cmene}, {vreji}, {gasnu}, {cmiveigau}, {cmisau}, {plivei}, {plicme}, {japyvla}.

cmevla

lujvo
x_1 is a morphologically defined name word meaning x_2 in language x_3.
In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

cmevo

experimental gismu
x_1 is a morphologically defined name word meaning x_2 in language x_3.
(By analogy with {brivo}; syn. {cmevla}) In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevo} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevo. See also {vlaturge'a}.

cmevycme

lujvo
x_1 is a cmevla-based name for x_2 used by namer x_3
{cmevo} + {cmene}. See {cmevla}, {brivycme}.

cmibi'o

lujvo
b_1=c_1 becomes a member of group b_2=c_2 under conditions b_3.
Cf. {cmima}, {binxo}, {kamni}.

cmicu'a

lujvo
cm_1=cu_1 votes for cu_2 among choices cu_3 in voting group cm_2.
Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

cmicu'akrali

lujvo
k_1 is suffrage entitled to k_2=cu_1 by standard k_3.
It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

cmigau

lujvo
g_1 puts together c_1 into group c_2.
Cf. {cmima}, {girzu}, {jmaji}, {gunma}.

cmila

gismu
-mi'a-
x_1 laughs (emotional expression).
x_1 laughs at x_2 (= {mi'afra}). See also {ckasu}, {frumu}, {xajmi}, {cisma}.

cmima

gismu
-mim-
-cmi-
x_1 is a member/element of set x_2; x_1 belongs to group x_2; x_1 is amid/among/amongst group x_2.
x_1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x_2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

cmimei

lujvo
x_1 (collection/sequence) has x_2 (number) members
See also {memkai}, {gunma}, {cmima}, {porsi}

cmisau

lujvo
s_1=c_1 is logged into system/application s_2=c_2.
Cf. {cmima}, {slabu}, {cmeveigau}, {plivei}, {plicme}, {japyvla}.

cmiveigau

lujvo
g_1=v_3 registers c_1 as a member of c_2, registration preserved in medium x_3=v_4.
Cf. {cmima}, {vreji}, {gasnu}, {cmeveigau}, {cmisau}, {plivei}.

cmizu'e

lujvo
z_1=c_1 participates in employing means/taking action z_2 for purpose/goal z_3.

cmoni

gismu
-cmo-
-co'i-
x_1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x_2 expressing x_3 (property).
Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

cmuxu'i

lujvo
x_1 is an element of kind x_2 with purity x_3.
Cf. {xumsle}, {ratni}, {jinme}, {trano}, {cidro}, {navni}.

cmuzilkri

lujvo
x_1 (du'u) is an axiom/doctrine/creed/postulate about subject x_2, foundational to system x_3
x_1 = {krici}_2 = {jicmu}_1, x_2 = {krici}_3, x_3 = {jicmu}_2. The system may be religious, philosophical, scientific, or mathematical. Refers to any proposition assumed as true without being proved within the system itself. See {sruma}

cnadakfu

lujvo
d_1=c_1 is a chisel for carving d_2=c_2 with blade of material d_3.
Cf. {rokci}, {mudri}, {jinme}, {tarmi}, {blixra}, {larcu}, {mruli}.

cnampetu

fu'ivla
x_1 is the angular momentum [vector] of x_2 in frame of reference x_3
See also: {impetu}, {ocnerta}, {carna}, {plankexu}.

cnano

gismu
-na'o-
x_1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x_2 (ka/ni) among x_3(s) (set) by standard x_4.
Also mean, normal, usual; (x_3 specifies the complete set). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

cnatufi

fu'ivla
x1 reflects/pertains to Epipaleolithic Natufian culture of/in specifics x2 in properties x3

cnebo

gismu
-neb-
-ne'o-
x_1 is a/the neck [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
See also {galxe}, {cutne}.

cnegau

lujvo
x_1 makes x_2 vary in property x_3 in amount x_4 under conditions x_5
See {cenba}, {gasnu}

cnemu

gismu
-nem-
-ne'u-
x_1 (agent) rewards x_2 [recipient] for atypical x_3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x_4.
Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); x_4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

cneparbi

lujvo
x_1 is the derivative of x_2 with respect to x_3.
Cf. {sa'o}, {cmaci}.

cnici

gismu
-nic-
x_1 is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity x_2 (ka/ni).
See also {cunso}, {kalsa}.

cnicni

lujvo
x_1 feels x_2 (ka) about x_3 feeling x_4 (ka) about x_5

cnicro

lujvo
co_1=ci_1 hurts emotionally due to ci_3.
Cf. {cortu}, {cinmo}, {cnixai}, {jgicro}, {badri}, {ckeji}.

cnida'o

lujvo
d_1=c_1 is far/distant from d_2 in feeling d_3=c_2.

cnija'o

lujvo
j_1=c_1 shows emotion j_2=c_2 (ka) about c_3 to audience j_3.
Cf. {badri}, {gleki}.

cnijicla

lujvo
j_1=c_3 excites j_2=c_1.
Cf. {tercni}.

cnikansa

lujvo
x_1 empathizes with x_2 in feeling x_3.
Cf. {cinmo}, {kansa}, {dai}, {uu}, {ga'i}, {tolcumla}.

cnima'o

lujvo
v_1 is an interjection/attitudinal meaning v_2=c_1 in language v_3.

cnimikce

lujvo
x_1=m_1 is a therapist treating x_2=m_2=c_1 for x_3=m_3=c_2 with treatment x_4=m_4.

cnino

gismu
-nin-
-ni'o-
x_1 is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x_2 in feature x_3 (ka) by standard x_4; x_1 is a novelty.
See also {nuzba}, {slabu}, {citno}, se {djuno}.

cnirango

lujvo
r_1 is the sense/feeling in c_1 of emotion c_2 about c_3.
Cf. {cinmo}, {rango}.

cnirei

lujvo
x_1=p_1 is a question about x_3=c_2=p_4’s emotion, asked by x_2=p_3 to x_3=c_3=p_4.

cniri'a

lujvo
x_1=r_1 (event) moves/touches x_2=c_1 (person), causing emotion x_3=c_2 about object of emotion x_4=c_3 with causation conditions x_5=r_3; x_1=r_1 (event) is moving/touching.
Cf. {cnicro}.

cnisa

gismu
-nis-
x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
See also {jinme}, {tinci}.

cnise'i

lujvo
s_1 is the heart (emotional self) of s_2=c_1.

cnisku

lujvo
x_1=ci_1=cu_1 expresses emotion x_2=ci_2=cu_2/emotionally expresses x_2 for audience x_3=cu_3 via expressive medium x_4=cu_4.

cnita

gismu
-nit-
-ni'a-
x_1 is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from x_2 in frame of reference x_3.
Also underside, nether. See also {dizlo}, {gapru}, {galtu}, {farna}, {loldi}.

cnitcini

lujvo
t_1=c_2 is the mood experienced by t_2=c_1 about c_3.
Cf. {selcni}, {tcini}.

cniva'u

lujvo
v_1 sighs due to emotion c_2 (ka) about c_3 breathing/respiring v_2.
Cf. {cinmo}, {vasxu}, {cmoni}, {sipfru}.

cnixai

lujvo
xr_1 offends xr_2=c_1 affecting emotion c_2 (ka) about c_3 resulting in xr_4 (state).
Cf. {cinmo}, {xrani}, {cnicro}, {jgicro}.

cnorailu'a

lujvo
x_1=p_1 is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature x_2=c_1=t_1 from x_3=p_2 to x_4=p_3
"Potential" in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

cnurmje

fu'ivla
x_1 reflects/pertains to the New World [from European explorer perspective] in aspect x_2 under standard/definition thereof x_3
Experimental gismu version: {numje}

co

cmavo
-col-
CO
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.

co'a

cmavo
-co'a-
ZAhO
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative >|< |.

co'acfa

lujvo
x_1=cf_1 [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
See {co'a} {cfari}. x_1 starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

co'arbi'o

lujvo
b_1 starts to become b_2 under conditions b_3.
Cf. {co'a}, {binxo}, {tolsisti}, {tolsti}, {cfagau}, {cfari'i}.

co'asku

lujvo
c_1 (agent) starts to express/say c_2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience c_3 via expressive medium c_4.
Cf. {co'a}, {cusku}.

cocyci'ekei

lujvo
k_1 plays charades/gesture-game ci_1=k_2 governed by rules ci_2 interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual; includes gestures) ci_3
From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

co'e

cmavo
-com-
-co'e-
GOhA
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.

coi

cmavo
COI
vocative: greetings/hello.

co'i

cmavo
ZAhO
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event >|<.

coico'o

cmavo-compound
COI*
vocative: greetings in passing.

coisna

lujvo
s_1=c_1 is a deep/rumbling sound produced by s_2=c_2 from point of reference c_3.
c_3 could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

cokcu

gismu
-cko-
x_1 soaks up/absorbs/sucks up x_2 from x_3 into x_4; x_1 is an absorbant.
See also {panje}, {sakci}, {lacpu}.

comco'e

lujvo
x_1 is a thingamajig / thing which the speaker can't put a predicate upon
See also {co'e}

condi

gismu
-con-
-cno-
-coi-
x_1 is deep in extent in direction/property x_2 away from reference point x_3 by standard x_4.
See also {clani}, {caxno}, {bargu}, {ganra}, {rotsu}, {barda}, {gutci}, {minli}.

conka

experimental gismu
x_1 is functional / usable for function x_2
Syn. {tolpo'u}. See {spofu}, {cikre}, {katci}, {pilno}, {plixau}

co'o

cmavo
COI
vocative: partings/good-bye.

co'oi

experimental cmavo
COI
Combination of {coi} and {co'o}, indicating either greetings or partings according to context.
The scalar negated forms of this COI are apparently identical to its positive form. cf. {coi}, {co'o}, {rinsa}, {tolrinsa}.

corci

experimental gismu
x_1 is a gesture/facial expression/body part motion/body language/expressive (nonverbal or nonvocal) feature/microexpression/stature/posture/sign/body signal [nonverbal expression made using only one's body parts and items on one's immediate person as extensions of the body in order to communicate; possibly nonlinguistic/extralinguistic] that conveys/expresses thought/emotion/command/idea x_2 (nu/si'o; possibly text and other types) made using body part/utensil/object/at locus x_3 in/by motion/action/means x_4
Must be body-oriented; any other object involved is simply for the matter of convenience and acts as an extension of the body (and thus must be on the performer's immediate person at or near the locus of the gesture). Body language, posturing, and stature are usually considered to be nonlocalized (body-general), although they need not be (and technically are not in general). Must be externally visible and/or internally sensed. Any non-body-part utensil/item (including clothing) must function as an extension of the body in the gesture. Need not be conscious or performed by a person (note that agent/performer is not mentioned in this definition); can, but need not, be accompanied by vocalizations (not necessarily linguistic), but the gesture itself is not primarily noise-producing. Might include sign language words or cheremes, although a more explicit word for linguistically organized and “full” cheremes is preferred (and especially for the sign language as a whole). x1 is possibly best typed by {nu} and/or {si'o}. x4 might be best expressed as an event; for example, it could be "the event of the right hand touching the chest near the heart, with fist clenched" for a salute, whereas/wherein x3 would be merely the fist/hand (and the chest near the heart). Use {cocygau} for: x1 (agent) gestures; x1 agentively/actively makes gesture x2, communicating x3, performed with body part(s) x4 in motion x5. Proposed short rafsi: -coc-.

corgau

lujvo
g_1 (agent) hurts/causes pain for c_1 at locus c_2.
Cf. {cortu}, {gasnu}, {crogau}, {crori'a}, {cnixai}.

cortu

gismu
-cor-
-cro-
x_1 hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus x_2.
See also {cinmo}, {xrani}.

co'u

cmavo
-co'u-
ZAhO
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative | >< |.

co'udzau

fu'ivla
x_1 cancels upvote-or-downvote for / "unlikes" x_2 in system x_3
Refers to systems (chiefly on the Internet) that keep a running tally of approval-votes, and sometimes disapproval-votes as well. See {ma'udzau}, {ni'udzau}, {adzau}, {nildzau}, {kansele}, {co'u}

co'urde'a

lujvo
x_1 quits/stops/aborts waiting/pausing for/until x_2 at state x_3 and starts/continues with x_4 (activity/process).
The pause waiting is not completed. See {co'u}, {denpa}.

co'urdu'u

lujvo
d_1 is relieved from stress/discomfort d_2
Cf. {surla}, {kufra}, {snura}, {gleki}.

co'urfa'o

lujvo
x_1 (event) has ceased happening and is not expected to start again.

co'urji'e

lujvo
j_1 dies / ceases to live; alive according to standard j_2.
Cf. {co'u}, {jmive}, {morsi}.

cpacu

gismu
-cpa-
x_1 gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts x_2 from source x_3 [previous possessor not implied].
Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}). See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

cpana

gismu
x_1 is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] x_2 in frame of reference/gravity x_3.
(x_1 may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

cpanygau

lujvo
g_1 causes c_1 to [rest on]/[be on top of]/[lie on] c_2 in frame of reference c_3.
Cf. {cpana}, {gasnu}.

cpanygle

lujvo
g_1=c_1 rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of g_2=c_2, in frame of reference/gravity c_3.
Cf. {glepe'o}, {gaxygle}.

cpapro

lujvo
f_1=c_1 refuses f_2=c_2 from c_3.
Cf. {fapro}.

cpare

gismu
-par-
x_1 climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface x_2 in direction x_3 using x_4 [limbs/tools].
See also {klama}, {litru}, {bajra}, {farlu}, {plipe}.

cpavlofi'ai

fu'ivla
x1 pertains to Pavlovian (Upper Paleolithic) technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) x2 in properties x3

cpazau

lujvo
z_1=c_1 approves the receipt of c_2 from c_3.
Cf. {cpacu}, {zanru}, {fitytu'i}, {radji'i}, {zarcpa}.

cpedu

gismu
-cpe-
x_1 requests/asks/petitions/solicits for x_2 of/from x_3 in manner/form x_4.
Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); x_4 is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor). (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

cpeirigordi

fu'ivla
x1 pertains to Périgordian technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) x2 in properties x3

cpesi'u

lujvo
x_1 ask each other for/request from each other x_2 in manner/form x_3
{cpedu} {simxu}

cpesku

lujvo
cu_1=cp_1 pleas/[expresses request] cu_2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to cu_3=cp_3 via expressive medium cu_4.
Cf. {cpedu}, {cusku}.

cpetinbe

lujvo
x_1 complies with/accedes to request x_2 made by x_3.
Cf. {cpezu'e}, {cperanda}, {vi'o}.

cpezu'e

lujvo
x_1 complies with request x_2 from x_3.
Cf. {cpedu}, {zukte}, {vi'o}, {cpetinbe}.

cpicinfo

lujvo
x_1 is a gryphon/griffin/griffon.
Cf. {cipni}, {cinfo}, {cizda'u}.

cpidodo

fu'ivla
x_1 is a dodo of species x_2

cpikakadu

fu'ivla
x_1 is a cockatoo of species x_2
See {cipni}

cpikiui

fu'ivla
x_1 is a kiwi bird (genus Apteryx) of species/type x_2
See {cipni}

cpikuku

fu'ivla
x_1 is a cuckoo (family Cuculidae) of species x_2
See also {cipni}

cpina

gismu
x_1 is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense x_2.
Also prickly (= {pecycpina}). See also {vrusi}, {kukte}, {cidja}, {panci}, {sumne}.

cpinyspa

lujvo
s_1 is a sense-irritating plant/thistle of species x_2.
Cf. {spati}, {cpina}.

cpinytsapi

lujvo
t_1=c_1 is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect t_2 (event/property).
Cf. {tsaprpiperi}, {kapsiku}, {armoraki}, {cidja}, {kukte}, {cortu}.

cpipika

fu'ivla
x_1 is a bird of species Pica Pica / Eurasian (Common) Magpie

cpirdinorni

fu'ivla
c_1 is a giant moa bird (genus Dinornis) of species c_2.

cpiremu

fu'ivla
c_1 is an emu bird (genus Dromaius) of species c_2.

cpirepiorni

obsolete fu'ivla
c_1 is an elephant bird (genus Aepyornis) of species c_2.

cpirkasuari

obsolete fu'ivla
c_1 is a cassowary bird (genus Casuarius) of species c_2.

cpirkivi

fu'ivla
c_1 is a kiwi bird (genus Apteryx) of species c_2.

cpirlre'a

fu'ivla
c_1 is a rhea bird (genus Rhea) of species c_2.

cpirlrinkotu

fu'ivla
c_1 is a Huayco or red-winged tinamou (genus Rhynchotus) of species c_2.

cpirnotoprokta

fu'ivla
c_1 is a tinamou bird (genus Nothoprocta) of species c_2.

cpirnotura

fu'ivla
c_1 is a tinamou bird (genus Nothura) of species c_2.

cpitepygau

lujvo
x_1 is a scarecrow for scaring off birds x_2

cpitukana

fu'ivla
x_1 is a toucan of species x_2

cpizda

lujvo
z_1 is a nest of bird z_2=c_1 of genus/species/etc. c_2.
Cf. {kolmba}, {sovda}.

cpolinomi'a

fu'ivla
x_1 is a formal polynomial with coefficients x2 (ordered list) of degree x_3 over structure/ring x_4 (to which coefficients x_2 all belong) and in indeterminant x_5
If x2 is presented as an ordered list, the entries represent the 'coefficients' of the particular polynomial and are specified in the order such that the ith entry/term is the (i-1)th 'coefficient' for all natural numbers i between 1 and n+1 inclusively; thus, the first entry is the constant term (when treated as a function), the second term is the coefficient of the argument of x5 (when treated as a function), and the nth term is the coefficient of the argument of x5 exponentiated by (n-1). See also: {tefsujme'o} (polynomial function)

cpubakni

lujvo
b_1=l_1 is/are (an) ox/oxen [cattle/beef-producer/bovine] for pulling/drafting l_2 by handle l_3 of species/breed b_2.

cpudalcarce

lujvo
c_1 is a horse cab/carriage/equipage for carrying c_2, propelled by animal(s) l_1=c_3 by handle/at locus l_3.

cpuga'ablo

lujvo
x_1 is a rowing boat or sculler, carrying x_2, pulled by x_3.

cpuga'ali'u

lujvo
x_1 rows or sculls on route x_2 with boat, rowing boat or scull x_3.

cpumi'i

lujvo
l_1=m_1 is a tractor pulling l_2.
Cf. {cpumuvgau}, {trene}, {karce}, {pulni}.

cpumuvgau

lujvo
g_1=l_1 pulls m_1=l_2 to destination m_2 from origin m_3 over path/route m_4 at handle/locus l_3.
Cf. {catke}, {bevri}, {jgari}, {cpumi'i}, {trene}, {pulni}.

cpupi'o

lujvo
p_1 is a harpsichord.
See also: {mrupi'o}, {balpi'o}, {sa'irpi'o}, {tu'urpi'o}, {runpi'o}, {dicpi'o}

cradi

gismu
x_1 broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] x_2 via station/frequency x_3 to [radio] receiver x_4.
Also x_1 is a broadcaster. See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

cradyvelcradi

lujvo
c_1 is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving c_2 on frequency c_3 to/from transceiver c_4.
The x_3 place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

crakemsazycimde

lujvo
ci_1=cr_1 is a heads-up display (HUD) for user s_1 of machine/system s_2 based on principle ci_3. It is shown/visible in front of cr_2, as seen from the user's viewpoint.
A very general sense of “heads-up display” is used here; it is not limited to one single application. For example, it could be used to refer to both the heads-up display of modern aircraft as well as the heads-up display in computing and video games. Cf. {crane}, {sazycimde}.

crakla

lujvo
k_1=c_1 advances to k_2 from k_3=c_2 via k_4 using means/vehicle k_5.
Cf. {klama}, {crane}.

craku'a

lujvo
k_1 is an anteroom of/in structure k_2 surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor k_3 (mass/jo'u).
Cf. {balku'a}.

crale'u

lujvo
l_1 is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set l_2 representing l_3.

crane

gismu
-cra-
x_1 is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of x_2 which faces/in-frame-of-reference x_3.
Also: x_3 is the standard of orientation for x_2. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

crarai

lujvo
t_1=c_1 is/are the frontmost among set/range t_4 which faces/in-frame-of-reference c_3.
Be careful not to use this when {li'enrai} is meant. Their meanings may overlap somewhat.

cravro

lujvo
v_1=c_1 is a front door/gateway/access between v_2 and v_3 of structure v_4.
Cf. {ti'evro}.

craxra

lujvo
p_1 is the front-cover picture/image/illustration showing p_2 made by artist p_3.
Cf. {crane}, {pixra}.

crebi'o

lujvo
c_1=b_1 becomes expert at c_2=b_2 under conditions b_3 by standard c_3.
Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

crejibri

lujvo
j_1=c_2 is a profession (job) of person j_2=c_1.
Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

creka

gismu
-cek-
x_1 is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material x_2.
See also {taxfu}.

crekafpra

lujvo
cu_1 is a barista/is skilled at making coffee drink/product cu_2=ck_1 by process cu_3.
See also espresso (={kafrspreso}), coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}).

crelai

lujvo
x_1 (person) has rank/skill level x_2 (li) in discipline/game/activity x_3

crenzue

obsolete fu'ivla
x_1 practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance x_2
This is a zi'evla made from crezenzu'e

crenzuue

fu'ivla
x_1 practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance x_2
zi'evla-shortening of {crezenzu'e}

crepu

gismu
-rep-
x_1 (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects x_2 from source/area x_3.
See also {critu}, {sombo}, {jmaji}.

creti'i

lujvo
x_1 suggests/offers expert advice/protip x_2 (ka) to x_3.
See also {certu}, {stidi}.

cretro

lujvo
j_1=c_1 skillfully handles j_2=c_2 in event j_3.

cre'udingar

cmevla
Schrödinger
If Lojban ever comes to accept the diphthong "eu", this word should delete the .y'y that it contains so that the first syllable nucleus is this diphthong. If Lojban ever accepts the Velarde nasal eng as a distinct letter, the "ng" string in this word should be replaced by it.

crexalbo

lujvo
c_1=xa_1 is a geek/nerd of field c_2=xa_2 (event/activity) by standard c_3.

crezenzu'e

lujvo
x_1 practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance x_2.
Cf. {rapcreze'a}, {xadyplijvi}.

cribe

gismu
-rib-
x_1 is a bear/ursoid of species/breed x_2.
See also {danlu}, {mabru}.

cribyjba

lujvo
x_1 is bearberry of species/variety x_2.

crida

gismu
-rid-
x_1 is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion x_2.
Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman. (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

cridyske

lujvo
s_1 (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion c_2 based on methodology s_3.
Cf. {crida}, {saske}, {ranmi}.

crigau

lujvo
x_1=g_1 causes x_2=c_1 to lose property x_3=c_2
The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

crimprau

fu'ivla
x_1 is a shrimp/prawn [general: no restrictions] of taxon/species/type x_2
See also: {praune} (freshwater only), {crimpui} (marine only).

crino

gismu
-ri'o-
x_1 is green/verdant [color adjective].
See also {skari}, {blabi}, {xekri}, {kandi}, {carmi}, {cicna}.

cripu

gismu
-rip-
x_1 is a bridge/span over/across x_2 between x_3 and x_4 [unordered, typically destination first].
See also {bargu}, {kruca}, {ragve}, {kuspe}.

crisa

gismu
-cis-
x_1 is summer/summertime [hot season] of year x_2 at location x_3.
See also {citsi}, {critu}, {dunra}, {vensa}.

critu

gismu
x_1 is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year x_2 at location x_3.
See also {citsi}, {crisa}, {dunra}, {vensa}, {crepu}.

crofanta

lujvo
x_1 is a painkiller for locus (body part) x_2
See {cortu}, {fanta}, {micyxu'i}, {nircadyxu'i}

crogau

lujvo
g_1 (agent) hurts/causes pain for c_1 at locus c_2.
Cf. {cortu}, {gasnu}, {corgau}, {crori'a}, {cnixai}.

crogle

lujvo
g_1 practices sadomasochism with g_2=c_1 with pain at locus c_2.
Cf. {bikla}, {laktergu'i}, {darxi}, {tunta}, {pinfu}, {katna}, {jesni}.

crori'a

lujvo
r_1 (event/state) hurts/causes pain for x_2=c_1 at locus x_3=c_2.
Cf. {cpina}, {crotsapi}, {crovu'i}, {xrani}.

crotsapi

lujvo
t_1 is hot spice.
Cf. {cpina}.

crovu'i

lujvo
v_1 is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by v_2.
Cf. {crotsapi}, {cpina}.

crujva

lujvo
x_1=j_1=c_1 is a rule permitting/allowing x_2=j_2=c_2 (event/state) within system/community x_3=j_3 under conditions x_4=c_3
The use of c_1 there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

crutcini

lujvo
t_1 is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event c_2=t_2 under conditions c_3.
As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped. Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

cruvei

lujvo
v_1 is a permit allowing c_2 (event) under conditions c_3, preserved in medium v_4.
Cf. {jaspu}, {e'a}.

ctaipe

fu'ivla
x_1 is a value/proof of type/proposition x_2 in (type/logical) system x_3
A better definition; proposed by la .mudri.

ctakamni

lujvo
k_1=c_1 is the audit committee of k_3.
Cf. {catlu}, {kamni}, {trukamni}, {trokamni}, {gazykamni}.

ctanuki

fu'ivla
x_1 is a tanuki/raccoon-dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides) of subspecies/breed x_2

ctaru

gismu
x_1 is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in x_2 caused by x_3.
See also {xamsi}.

ctebi

gismu
-teb-
x_1 is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice x_2 of body x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is labial.
See also {moklu}, {korbi}, {cinba}.

ctecmocpi

lujvo
x_1 is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species x_2.
Cf. {ctesa'acpi}, {rasycpi}.

ctecpi

lujvo
c_1 is an owl of species c_2.
Cf. {cipni}, {nicte}.

ctecutci

lujvo
c_1 is a slipper (shoe primarily for wearing at night) for wearing on [feet/hooves] c_2, made of material c_3.
See also {nicte}, {cutci}.

ctejau

lujvo
d_1 is dew.

cteki

gismu
-tek-
-ce'i-
x_1 is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event x_2 levied against x_3 by authority/collector x_4.
Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

ctemanku

lujvo
m_1 is dark of night of day n_2 at location n_3.

ctemidju

lujvo
m_1 is the midnight of n_2 at location n_3.
Cf. {nicte}, {midju}, {dormidju}.

ctenalcando

lujvo
c_1 is nocturnal/active during the nighttime n_1.
Also (figurative): nightbird, nightowl.

cternalmat

cmevla
Chinese checkers

ctesa'acpi

lujvo
x_1 is a nightingale of species/variety x_2.
Cf. {sfanykavycpi}, {ctecmocpi}.

ctesai

lujvo
s_1 is a supper composed of dishes including s_2.
Cf. {vacysai}, {dormijysai}, {cersai}, {cidja}, {citka}.

cticinza

lujvo
cin_1 is a/are chopstick(s) for eating cit_2.
Cf. {jungo}, {ponjo}.

cticpe

lujvo
cp_1 orders food ci_2 for cp_2 from cp_3 in manner/form cp_4.
Cf. {cidja}, {gusta}, {barjyse'u}, {beipre}, {djabei}, {djabeipre}.

ctidakfu

lujvo
d_1 is a table knife for cutting food d_2=c_2, with blade of material d_3.
Cf. {forca}, {smuci}, {palta}.

ctidji

lujvo
x_1 has appetite for x_2
{citka} {djica}

ctigau

lujvo
g_1 feeds c_1 with food c_2.
Cf. {citka}, {cidja}, {kurji}, {gusta}.

ctikabri

lujvo
x1=k1 is a bowl for food x2=c2=k2 made from material x3=k3

ctikembrasmuci

lujvo
sm_1=b_1 is/are tablespoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for eating sm_2=c_2 made of material s_3.
See also: tablespoon (measuring unit={mucydekpu}/measuring instrument={mucydekpyvau}).

ctiku'a

lujvo
k_1 is a dining room in structure k_2 surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor k_3 (mass/jo'u).
Cf. {ckaku'a}.

ctile

gismu
x_1 is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source x_2.
See also {grasu}.

ctilytarla

lujvo
t_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of asphalt from source t_2
Cf. {tarla}.

ctilytergu'i

lujvo
x_1 is an oil lamp using petroleum-based products, illuminating x_2 with light x_1.
Cf. {ctile}, {gusni}, {laktergu'i}, {fagytergu'i}, {dictergu'i}, {rastergu'i}.

ctilyvau

lujvo
v_1 is a fuel tank.
Cf. {karce}, {matra}.

ctino

gismu
-ti'o-
x_1 is a shadow/the shade of object x_2, made by light/energy source x_3.
See also {manku}, {gusni}.

ctipla

lujvo
p_1 sets up diet p_2 for c_1 consisting of food c_2.
Cf. {xadyplijvi}, {ctinei}.

ctiru'e

lujvo
p_1 is the digestion of food p_2=c_2 with output p_3 passing through stage p_4 of person/animal/plant c_1.
Cf. {ctiru'egau}, {befru'e}, {djarunta}, {djaruntygau}, {djaruntyrango}, {xelbefru'e}.

ctiru'egau

lujvo
g_1 digests food p_2=c_2 with output p_3 passing through stage p_4 of person/animal/plant c_1.
Cf. {ctiru'e}, {befru'e}, {djarunta}, {djaruntygau}, {djaruntyrango}, {xelbefru'e}.

ctisla

lujvo
s_1 celebrates s_2 with a banquet/feast.
Cf. {specfari'i}, {jbedetnunsla}, {balsai}, {nuncti}.

ctitci

lujvo
t_1 is cutlery for eating c_2.
Cf. {ctidakfu}, {forca}, {smuci}, {palta}.

ctixau

lujvo
x_1 is edible to x_2
See {citka}, {xamgu}; modeled after {plixau}

ctodje

lujvo
d1 is d2 full hectodays (hundred day unit) in duration (default is 1 hectoday) by standard d3
For use with metric dating system.

ctona'a

lujvo
x_1 is x_2 centuries in duration by standard x_3.
The default x_2 is 1; Cf. {xecto}, {nanca}, {cedra}.

ctrumfi

fu'ivla
x_1 is a Smurf [ficitional being] characterized by significant property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension x_2 (ka); x_1 is/are smurf/smurfing in aspect x_2 [corresponds to the undefinable word
From "Les Schtroumpfs" (French). The name was later translated into Dutch as Smurf, which was adopted in English. See also: runcible (={rarnsibe}).

ctuca

gismu
-ctu-
x_1 teaches audience x_2 ideas/methods/lore x_3 (du'u) about subject(s) x_4 by method x_5 (event).
Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) x_1/x_5 is pedagogical. See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

ctuci'e

lujvo
ci_1 is an education system interrelated by administrative policies ci_2 among institutions ci_3=ct_1 displaying quality ci_4.
Cf. {ctuca}, {cilre}, {tadni}, {ckule}, {balcu'e}, {ma'urcu'e}.

ctucku

lujvo
cu_1=ct_1 is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods ct_3 (du'u), by author cu_3 for audience cu_4=ct_2 about subject(s) ct_4 by method ct_5, preserved in medium cu_5.
Cf. {clinoi}, {ckule}.

ctufau

lujvo
f_1 is a lesson by c_1 for teaching audience c_2 ideas/methods/lore c_3 (du'u) about subject(s) c_4 by method c_5 (event).
*naljvajvo warning! Please use {nunctu} instead* Cf. {ckule}, {balcu'e}, {ctucku}.

ctugu'a

lujvo
x_1=g_1=c_2 works on x_2=g_2=c_5 for teacher x_3=c_1 to learn facts x_4=c_3 about subject x_5=c_4

ctunoi

lujvo
n_1 are instructions by c_1 teaching audience c_2 ideas/methods/lore c_3 (du'u) about subject(s) c_4 by method c_5 (event).
Cf. {ctufau}, {ctucku}, {cilre}.

ctununta'a

lujvo
x_1=n_1=c_5 is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by x_2=t_1=c_1 to audience x_3=t_2=c_2 about subject x_4=t_3=c_4 in language x_5=t_4 with facts taught x_6=c_3.
Cf. {ctuca}, {nu}, {tavla}, {ckule}, {cilre}.

cu

cmavo
CU
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.

cu'a

cmavo
VUhU3
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm |a|.

cu'acmi

lujvo
cm_1=cu_1 is a member of electorate cm_2, which votes/selects cu_2 [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives cu_3.
Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

cu'ai

experimental cmavo
VUhU3
binary mathematical operator: vector norm/magnitude of vector a in structure (normed vector space) b
Contextless default for b: Euclidean normed vector space over the reals or complexes; in relativity, without context, the default interpretation for a four-vector is the Minkoski magnitude. b determines the meaning of the norm. Accompanies and clarifies {cu'a}.

cu'alni

fu'ivla
x_1 is the absolute value of x_2
Syn. {nacnilbra}. See {cu'a}, {cu'alvu'u}

cu'alvu'u

fu'ivla
x_1 is the absolute difference of numbers x_2 and x_3 ; x_1 = |x_2 - x_3|
See {cu'alni}, {vujnu}, {cu'a}, {vu'u}

cu'arkubli

lujvo
k_1=c_1 is a gaming die, with sides k_3=c_3, with side c_2 facing up and having dimensions k_2.
Cf. {kelkubli}.

cu'au

experimental cmavo
universial famyma'o: terminates the most recently opened construct or clause.
cu'au looks back for the most recently opened construct that has not been terminated, and emulates whatever {famyma'o} would terminate it. It can also be subscripted with {xi}, and will terminate that many times. Note that that means grammatical function is being put in a {xi} clause, so be careful when using it. Additionally, cu'au {xi} {ro} will terminate all the way up to the last sentence-starting word (.i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au xi ro -> .i mi klama lo zarci pe lo pendo be mi cu'au-be'o-ku-ge'u-ku-vau). This will also terminate to sentences started in {lu} (will NOT emulate li'u UNLESS used multiple times), {ni'o}, and {no'i}. It will NOT emulate {le'u}. In addition to {ro}, it can be subscripted with {da'a}, which terminates to the sentence level, minus 1. In the previous example, this would just leave the {vau} remaining, and allow you to continue to add to the place structure of {klama}.

cu'au'ei

experimental cmavo
VUhU
mekso binary/unary operator: multinomial coefficient/binomial coefficient/choose
If unary, a list (n_1,...,n_r) must be supplied as input; the terms of the list may not be distinct; for appropriate values, output is ((n_1 +...+ n_r)!)/((n_1)! *...* (n_r)!). If binary, a single number n must be supplied for the first variable and the second variable must be a list (k_1,...,k_s); for appropriate values, the output is (n!)/((k_1 !) * ((n - k_1)!) *...* (k_s !) * ((n - k_s)!)); note that this is not exactly the typical definition, but it allows for easier immediate usage for the binomial case (where s=1).

cu'a zei fancu

zei-lujvo
f_1 is an absolute value function from domain f_2 to range f_3.
Defined by: f(x) = abs(x)

cucma'e

lujvo
m_1 is a skate carrying m_2 on surface/medium m_3.
Cf. {carcycutci}, {bisli}, {xislu}, {cucyxelkla}, {xilcutci}, {xilcucli'u}.

cucti'e

lujvo
t_1 is the heel of shoe t_2=c_1 for covering/protecting feet c_2, and of material c_3.
Cf. {jmati'e}, {cucni'a}.

cucycau

lujvo
cl_1 is barefoot/not wearing shoes.
Cf. {smoka}, {karcutci}, {tupcutci}.

cucydegji

lujvo
x_1=d_1 is the toe of shoe x_2=d_2=c_1.
See also {cucti'e}.

cucyxelkla

lujvo
x_1=k_5 is a roller skate to destination k_2 from origin k_3 via route k_4, transporting x_5=k_1.
Cf. {carcycutci}, {xilcucli'u}.

cu'e

cmavo
CUhE
tense/modal question.

cu'ei

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have {sa'a} attached to it by default. Using {sa'anai} would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'a

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'a; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'ai

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to first person (mi); used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'e

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'e; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'ei

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to general third person (zo'e); used generally in quotations.
Notes: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'i

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'i; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'o

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'o; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'oi

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to second person (do); used generally in quotations.
Notes: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'ei'u

experimental cmavo
UI
discursive: indicate a change in speaker to ko'u; used generally in quotations.
Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

cu'i

cmavo
CAI
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.

cukcartu

lujvo
x_1 is a pie-chart of/about x_2 showing formation/data-points x_3.
See {cukla} {cartu}

cukla

gismu
-cuk-
x_1 is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; x_1 is a disk/circle/ring.
Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'. See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

cukli'u

lujvo
l_1 goes/moves around/[in a circle] using means l_3.
Cf. {cukla}, {litru}.

cukmakyvelvei

lujvo
v_4=m_1=c_1 is a computer disk/hard disk/floppy disk storing v_2 (data/facts/du'u) about v_3 (object/event) in file(s) v_1.
Cf. {vreji}, {datni}, {skami}, {makyvelvei}, {srimakyvelvei}, {cukmirvelvei}.

cukmirvelvei

lujvo
v_4=m_1=c_1 is a compact disc/optical disc storing v_2 (data/facts/du'u) about v_3 (object/event) in file(s) v_1.
Cf. {vreji}, {datni}, {skami}, {cukmakyvelvei}, {cukyku'ovelvei}, {srimakyvelvei}.

cukmu'o

lujvo
m_1=c_1 (object) is completely round/full.
Cf. {mluni}, {lunra}, {nicte}.

cukpabna'u

lujvo
x_1 is the mathematical constant π (the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter)

cukre

experimental gismu
x_1 reflects/relates to/pertains to CLL (Lojbanic) grammatical standards in manner/aspect x_2, specific to version x_3 (contextless default: the most recent version that has been officially accepted by the Lojban language's governing body (presently, the BPFK))
See also: {xorlo}.

cukrerkavjvi

lujvo
j_1 plays ultimate frisbee against j_2 in competition j_3 for prize/title j_4.
See also {cukla}, {renro}, {kavbu}, {jivna}.

cukta

gismu
-cku-
x_1 is a book containing work x_2 by author x_3 for audience x_4 preserved in medium x_5.
[x_1 is a manifestation/container A physical object or its analogue. of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri})]; See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

cuktai

lujvo
t_1=c_1 is a circle.
Cf. {cukmirvelvei}.

cukygu'ivelvei

lujvo
v_4=g_2=c_1 is a compact disc/optical disc storing v_2 (data/facts/du'u) about v_3 (object/event) in file(s) v_1.
Cf. {cukmirvelvei}, {vreji}, {datni}, {skami}, {cukmakyvelvei}, {cukyku'ovelvei}, {srimakyvelvei}.

cukyku'ovelvei

lujvo
v_4 is a gramophone record of v_2.
Cf. {cukmirvelvei}, {zgike}, {sance}, {snaveitci}, {srimakyvelvei}.

cukyxratci

lujvo
x_1 is a compass for drawing circles x_2.
Cf. {makfartci}, {caltaicmaci}.

culcpe

lujvo
cp_1 humbly asks for/implores cp_2 from cp_3 in manner/form cp_4.
Cf. {pikci}, {tolcumla}.

culno

gismu
-clu-
x_1 is full/completely filled with x_2.
See also {tisna}, {kunti}, {mulno}, {setca}, {tisna}.

cumgau

lujvo
x_1 enables x_2 (event) to happen; x_1 makes x_2 possible
See {cumki}, {gasnu}, {curmi}

cumki

gismu
-cum-
-cu'i-
x_1 (event/state/property) is possible under conditions x_2; x_1 may/might occur; x_1 is a maybe.
Also possibility. See also {lakne}.

cumla

gismu
-cul-
x_1 is humble/modest about x_2 (abstraction); x_1 displays humility about x_2.
See also {cinmo}, {jgira}.

cumnunve'u

lujvo
n_1 is a sales lead/opportunity for v_1 to sell v_2 to v_3 for amount v_4.
Cf. {cumki}, {nu}, {vecnu}, {vencu'u}, {velventerzu'e}.

cumselpei

lujvo
x_1=p_2=c_1 (subject/concept) is conceivable under conditions c_2.
Cf. {xanri}, {lojycpa}.

cumymu'efi'a

lujvo
cf_1 is science fiction about possible universe cu_1=m_1 by author cf_3.
Cf. {skefi'a}, {mi'irlarfi'a}.

cundinkei

lujvo
k_1 gambles/plays the lottery k_2.
Gambling/lottery = {nuncundinkei}.

cunfai

lujvo
f_1 is shuffled/randomly distributed/cut among f_2 with shares/portions f_3.
Cf. {cunfaigau}, {karda}, {kelci}.

cunfaigau

lujvo
g_1 shuffles/randomly distributes/cuts x_2=f_1 among x_3=f_2 with shares/portions x_4=f_3.
Cf. {cunfai}, {karda}, {kelci}.

cunmi

gismu
x_1 is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain x_2.
See also {gurni}.

cunpe'i

lujvo
p_1 bumps into/randomly encounters p_2 at/in location p_3.

cunso

gismu
-cun-
-cu'o-
x_1 is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions x_2, with probability distribution x_3.
Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable"). See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

cuntu

gismu
-cu'u-
x_1 is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) x_2 (ind./mass); x_1 is x_2's business.
Also matter, concern; x_2 is engaged in x_1 (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

cunyna'u

lujvo
n_1=c_1 (li) is a random number (noun), random under conditions c_2, with probability distribution c_3.
Cf. {cundinkei}, {cunfaigau}, {lakne}.

cu'o

cmavo
MOI
convert number to probability selbri; event x_1 has probability (n) of occurring under cond. x_2.

cupli'u

lujvo
l_1 makes a round trip via route l_2 using means/vehicle l_3.

cupra

gismu
-pra-
x_1 produces x_2 [product] by process x_3.
See also {zbasu}, {farvi}, {gundi}, {jukpa}.

cupsri

lujvo
d_1=c_1 is a looped ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe [both ends are connected] and is of material d_2=c_2.

cupypoi

lujvo
p_1=c_1 is a circularly ordered sequence by rule p_2 on unordered set p_3.
Cf. {clupa}, {porsi}.

curfi'e

lujvo
c_1=f_1 is an eel of species/breed c_2=f_2.
Cf. {curnu}, {finpe}, {xasycurnu}.

curmi

gismu
-cru-
x_1 (agent) lets/permits/allows x_2 (event) under conditions x_3; x_1 grants privilege x_2.
Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}). See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

curnu

gismu
-cur-
x_1 is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed x_2.
Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike. See also {since}, {silka}.

curnureki

fu'ivla
x_1 is Urechis

curnxidrozo'a

fu'ivla
x_1 is a member of Hydrozoa/hydrozoan of subtaxa x_2
See also: {curnu}, {finpe}

curve

gismu
-cuv-
x_1 is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property x_2 (ka).
x_1 is simply/purely/unmitigatedly/solely x_2. See also {prane}, {jinsa}, {manfo}, {sampu}, {sepli}, {traji}, {lumci}, {xukmi}.

cuska'i

lujvo
x_1=k_1 is a spokesperson of/speaks on behalf of x_2=k_2=c_1, saying x_3=c_2 to x_4=c_3 via expressive medium x_5=c_4.
cf. {cusku}, {krati}, cmavo list {ka'i}

cusku

gismu
-cus-
-sku-
x_1 (agent) expresses/says x_2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience x_3 via expressive medium x_4.
Also says. See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

cusku'i

lujvo
x_1 edits/revises/adapts text x_2 by x_3 for audience x_4 in medium x_5.
Cf. {cusku}, {kurji}, {sa'a}.

cusna

experimental gismu
x_1 (scalar-valued) is the magnitude of (four-)vector x_2 in metric/by definition x_3

custerzi'e

lujvo
z_3 is a condition for free expressive activity z_2 by agent z_1=c_1.
Cf. {nunzi'e}.

cutci

gismu
-cuc-
x_1 is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] x_2, and of material x_3.
Also boot (= {tupcutci}). See also {smoka}, {taxfu}, {skiji}.

cutne

gismu
-cut-
x_1 is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of x_2.
See also {cnebo}, {betfu}, {xadni}, {tanxe}.

cutybo'u

lujvo
b_1 is a rib of body b_3=c_2.
Cf. {cutygreku}, {cutyti'e}.

cutygreku

lujvo
g_1=c_1 is the ribcage of c_2.
Cf. {cutyti'e}, {cutybo'u}.

cutyti'e

lujvo
t_1 is the upper back [body-part] of c_2.
Cf. {cutygreku}, {cutybo'u}, {betfu}, {xadni}.

cu'u

cmavo
BAI
cusku modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation) as said by source ...; used for quotation.

cu'u ko'a

cmavo-compound
BAI*
tagged sumti: can be used for embedded: it-1 said, "...", with editorial unquote and insert.

cu'upre

lujvo
p_1 is a businessman/business woman involved in business c_1.
Cf. {cuntu}, {prenu}, {kagni}, {briju}, {banxa}.

cu'urga'o

lujvo
g_1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing access to organized activity g_2=c_1 by g_3.

cu'urkalri

lujvo
k_1 (store/company/organization/entrance-way etc) is open/ajar/not shut permitting access to organized activity k_2=c_1 by k_3.

cu'uxna

fu'ivla
x_1 is aware that x_1 can be in relation x_4 with all of x_3 (plural) and choose to be in relation x_4 with x_2 (which is among x_3)
To summarize, "x_1 chooses x_2 out of set x_3 to do/have relationship x_4 (binary ka)". See also {cuxna}

cuvjumske

lujvo
s_1=j_1=c_1 is bacteriology of bacteria s_2 based on methodology s_3.
Bacteriology is the study of bacteria. Because of the similarity of thinking and working with microorganisms other than bacteria, there has been a tendency for the field of bacteriology to extend as microbiology (={jumske}). Bacteriology can be classified as a distinct science.

cuvjurme

lujvo
j_1=c_1 is an (eu)bacterium of species/defining property j_2.
Bacteria are a large domain of single-celled, prokaryote (={pruslemijyji'e}) microorganisms. See also {jurme}, {tceprujurme}.

cuxna

gismu
-cux-
-cu'a-
x_1 chooses/selects x_2 [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives x_3 (complete set).
Also prefer (= {nelcu'a}). See also {jdice}, {pajni}, {nelci}.

cuxselgre

lujvo
p_2=c_1 filters p_1=c_2 to destination side p_3 from origin side p_4.
Cf. {julne}.

cuxselnandu

lujvo
x_1 hesitates on which of x_2 (plural) to choose for doing x_3 (relation) with it/them
See also {cuxtoi}, {cuxna}.

cuxtoi

lujvo
x_1 is trying to choose which of x_2 (plural) to be in relation x_3 with

cy

cmavo
BY2
letteral for c.

cy'i'am

cmevla
Central Intelligence Agency

da

cmavo
-dav-
-dza-
KOhA1
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).

da'a

cmavo
-daz-
PA4
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.

da'a'au

experimental cmavo
VUhU
mekso operatory: prime mark append
For ordered inputs (A, B, C), where A is a general mathematical object, B is an integer (normally nonnegative), and C is a nonnegative integer; appends B prime(s)/distinguishing marks of type C to A. Presumably objects that have the same symbol as A but different B and C values are mutual(ly) related/analogs, but are at least formally distinguishable. B and C each default to 1. In practice, tick marks are usually called prime marks (and probably will effectively/culturally have a value of C=1); other distinguishing features are employed usually once these are used, such as overbars, over-tildes/over-twiddles, dagger, asterisks, etc. For a fixed C, this operator forms a series in B for each A. The meaning is context-specific. B = 0 iff C = 0; if A in unprimed (lacks any distinguishing marks), then B = 0; thus all mathematical objects have this operator implicitly attached to them with the value of 0 for the second and third argumentsize (note that this is not the default value for these arguments when this operator is explicitly mentioned). It is possible therefore to reference both primed and unprimed objects of form A simultaneously via reference to, for example, (1±1)/2 for the value for B and/or C (employing the setting of defaulting to the value of 1 as appropriate).

da'acre

lujvo
x_1 is an expert-fight with opponent [in fight] x_2 with expertise standard x_3.

da'ai

experimental cmavo
KOhA3
other than me
Can include {do}. {ma'a} can be defined as "{mi} {jo'u} {do} jo'u {da'ai}"

da'amei

cmavo-compound
MOI*
quantifier selbri: convert all but one to cardinal selbri; x_1 is a set with all but one members x_2.

da'amoi

cmavo-compound
MOI*
quantified selbri: converts all-but-(1) to ordinal selbri; x_1 is penultimate among x_2 by rule x_3.

da'ane'e

cmavo-compound
PA*4
digit/number: counting from least contextually-possible number; least possible number + n; default n=1
Counts up from {rone'e}, similar to how {da'a} counts down from {ro}

da'aremoi

cmavo-compound
MOI*
quantified selbri: converts all-but-2 to ordinal selbri; x_1 is antepenult. among x_2 by rule x_3.

da'arsi'u

lujvo
s_1 fight [each other] over issue d_3 (abstract).
Cf. {damba}, {simxu}, {simda'a}, {da'asnu}, {dausnu}, {da'arta'a}.

da'arta'a

lujvo
t_1=d_1 quarrels with t_2=d_2 about issue t_3=d_3 in language t_4.
Cf. {damba}, {tavla}, {dausnu}, {da'arsi'u}.

da'asnu

lujvo
c_1 (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) argues/quarrels about topic/subject c_2=d_3 with opponent x_3=d_2.
Cf. {darlu}, {casnu}, {dausnu}, {da'arsi'u}, {simda'a}.

da'au

experimental cmavo
KOhA1
pro-sumti: forgetful something/memory-less da
Functions as {da} does with respect to existential quantification. Each usage acts as though the scope of all previous usages have been closed/terminated (or that all assignments to the meaning of this word have been forgotten/erased/overridden/unassigned). Even within the same given scope, multiple usages of this word can refer to different things (with or without qualification) and are (modulo qualification) completely free in their reference sets absolutely and with respect to one another; of course, they can mean the same thing, but it is not necessary. Usage within prenexes is essentially pointless if intended to be used after the same. See also: {da'o}, {da}, {kau'a}, {kau'e}, {kau'i}, {zo'e}.

dabycalku

lujvo
c_1 is armor around c_2 composed of c_3 against opponent x_4=d_2.
Cf. {gunta}, {jamna}, {danti}, {jakne}, {xarci}.

dabysmifau

lujvo
f_1 (event) is a wargame, simulating combat by d_1 against d_2 over issue d_3 (abstract).
Cf. {jamna}, {bilni}.

dabytadji

lujvo
t_1 is a fighting technique / martial art used under conditions t_3 by d_1.
t2 subsumed. d2 and d3 not usually relevant to technique. Made from {damba} + {tadji}.

dacru

gismu
-dac-
x_1 is a drawer/file in structure x_2, a [sliding compartment] container for contents x_3.
See also {nilce}, {tanxe}.

dacti

gismu
-dai-
x_1 is a material object enduring in space-time; x_1 is a thing.
See also {marji}, {xanri}.

dacybatke

lujvo
b_1 is a drawer pull on drawer b_2=d_1; the drawer pull is made of material b_4.

dadgau

lujvo
g_1 hangs/suspends d_1 from d_2 with/by means d_3.

dadgreku

lujvo
x_1 is a rack used to hang x_2.

dadja'i

lujvo
j_1=d_1 is a pendant decorating j_2 and hanging from d_2.
See also: {dandu}, {jadni}.

dadjo

gismu
-daj-
x_1 pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect x_2.
See also {lijda}, {jegvo}.

dadne'ota'u

lujvo
t_1 is a necktie for wearing by t_2=c_2 serving purpose t_3.
Cf. {nebysrijge}.

dadycatra

lujvo
c_1 hangs/lynches c_2=d_1 by hanging them from/on d_2 by means of d_3.
x2 is killed by this action. Use {dadgau} if x2 is already dead.

dadycka

lujvo
c_1=d_1 is a hammock of material c_2 hung from d_2.
Cf. {daklycka}.

dadycripu

lujvo
c_1=d=1 is a bridge which is suspended from d_2 at joint/joints d_3.

dadyskotai

lujvo
x_1 is a catenary (ideal shape) of form x_2

dadysli

lujvo
s_1=d_1 is a pendulum oscillating at rate/frequency s_2, suspended from d_2 by/at/with joint d_3.

da'e

cmavo
KOhA2
pro-sumti: remote future utterance; "He'll tell you tomorrow. IT will be a doozy.".

da'ei

experimental cmavo
DOI
attitudinal cause attribution
Whereas dai simply marks an attitudinal as applying to someone other than the speaker, and da'oi attributes the preceding attitudinal as belonging to someone specific, da'ei attributes the cause of one's feeling to someone/something else.

da'ergau

lujvo
g_1 [person/agent] applies force d_1, which puts pressure on/presses/applies force to d_2.
See also {selda'ergau}, {da'erzu'e}, {danre}, {gasnu}.

da'erjicla

lujvo
x1=d1=j1 kneads x2=d2=j2

da'erju'ebo'i

lujvo
b_1 is a french press/press pot/coffee press/coffee plunger/cafetière/сafetière à piston for filtrated liquid b_2=j_2 [default: coffee] with filter j_1 prohibiting passage of solids j_3=d_2 pressed by force d_1, container made of material b_3 with lid b_4.
See also: making coffee (={kafpra}), coffeemaker (={kafpraca'a}), coffee (paper) filter (={kafpleju'e}).

da'erzu'e

lujvo
z_1 is a volitional entity causing the force d_1, which presses d_2, and the entity does so to achieve goal z_3.
See also {da'ergau}, {selda'ergau}, {danre}, {zukte}.

dafsku

lujvo
c_1 (agent) answers x_2=d_1 to question/problem x_3=d_2.

dafyfa'i

lujvo
f_1 finds solution/answer to problem/question f_3=d_2

dagme'esni

lujvo
s_1 is a road sign representing a/the name s_2=c_1 of road/street c_2=d_1—name given by c_3—to observer s_3.
Cf. {dagysni}, {cmene}.

dagmlaterdzu

x_1 is a sidewalk of road x_2.
See also {dargu}, {mlana}, {cadzu}.

dagypli

lujvo
p_1 (person) is a road user using road/highway/street/path/(square) d_1=p_2 for purpose p_3.
x1 could be a driver/passenger/pedestrian/skater/cyclist etc.

dagysfe

lujvo
s_1 is pavement of road/highway x_2=d_1.

dagysni

lujvo
s_1 is a road sign meaning s_2 to observer/driver/pedestrian s_3.
Cf. {klaji}, {tcita}.

dai

cmavo
UI5
attitudinal modifier: marks empathetic use of preceding attitudinal; shows another's feelings.
See also {cnijmi}.

da'i

cmavo
UI3
discursive: supposing - in fact.
See also {sruma}.

da,ic

cmevla
IS, ISIS, ISIL, the Islamic State; ad-Dawlah al-Islāmiyah fī 'l-ʿIrāq wa-sh-Shām, Da'ish, Daesh

daigno

fu'ivla
x_1 (ordered list) is a sampling of entries of matrix/tensor x_2 in which exactly one entry is sampled from each row and/or column (etc.) between entries x_3 (list; default: the largest 'square'/'hypercubic' sampling possible in the entire tensor starting with the first entry, see notes) inclusively following selection procedure/rule/function/order x_4 (default: diagonally, see notes), where the tensor/matrix is expressed in basis/under conditions x_5
Entries of the list in x3 need not actually be sampled; the entries listed are merely to name the minimal and maximal indices between which the sampling may be drawn. Thus, the indices/labels specified are included in the range of sampling; id est: if the matrix entries listed belong to the ith row and jth column and the (i+n)th row and (j+m)th column respectively (for positive integers i,j,n,m), then the sampling will be conducted in all rows of number between (and including) i and i+n (yielding n+1 sampled rows) and in all columns of number between (and including) j and j+m (yielding m+1 sampled columns). The default diagonal sampling procedure for x4 is as follows: The first sampled entry has the minimum allowed (as specified in x3) indices. All latter sampled entries (by default) have indices of the immediately previous sampled entry each augmented by 1. (Which is to say that if the kth sampled entry has indices (x,y,...), in that order, then the (k+1)th sampled entry has indices (x+1,y+1,...), in that order and where each subsequent index would be the respective index of the kth sampled entry augmented by 1). The process terminates generally whenever exactly one entry is sampled from each of the rows, each of the columns, etc. of the tensor. In the default, the process terminates when at least one of the indices of a sampled entry of the tensor is as large as possible in the range specified by x3. Thus, in order to reconcile the general and the default termination conditions, the range specified by x3 must be compatible with both; id est: it must be a r-dimensional hypercube of entries, so to speak, where r is the rank of tensor x2. The default for sampling range x3 is between and including the entry in the first row and first column (etc.) and the entry in the last row and last column (etc.) for an r-dimensional hypercube tensor (meaning that each row, column, etc. of the tensor has exactly the same number of entries as the others). Generally, the default range begins with the entry of indices each minimal in the tensor (called 'the first entry') and extends to include ("draw") the maximal r-dimensional hypercube of entries in the tensor with one vertex on the first entry; in other words, if the minimum of the set of maximal indices in the tensor is g, then the sampling range is every row between the first and the gth, every column between the first and the gth, etc. Generally, the sampling range must be an r-dimensional orthotope of some positive size (that is to say: including at least one entry) no larger than the tensor itself, but with the freedom to place at most r of its vertices among the entries thereof; if the default sampling procedure x4 is being used, then the r-dimensional orthotope must be an r-dimensional hypercube. Generalizes to any tensor, but is only interesting for tensors of rank at least 1. Any mention of geometric terminology (such as mention of diagonals, orthotopes, etc.) in the definition or notes of this word should be interpreted cautiously and is not necessarily good Lojbanic practice; such terminology should not necessarily be emulated in practicing Lojbanic thought or speech. Not for use for geometric diagonals (such as between vertices); confer: {digno}.

dai'i

experimental cmavo
CAI
attitudinal modifier: supposed emotion - factual emotion
Used for emotions that are non-factual, for example when talking about hypothetical events. la'a ui dai'i mi ba te dunda lo karce lo mi patfu I will probably be given a car by my dad and I would feel happy about it if that happened.

daiic

cmevla
IS, ISIS, ISIL, the Islamic State; ad-Dawlah al-Islāmiyah fī 'l-ʿIrāq wa-sh-Shām, Da'ish, Daesh

da'inai

cmavo-compound
UI*3
discursive: supposing - in fact.

da'inpei

fu'ivla
x_1 (agent) hypothesizes x_2 (si'o/du'u/nu); x_1 assumes x_2 for the sake of analysis
See {da'i}, {da'inri}, {pensi}, {xarpei}, {sruma}

da'inri

fu'ivla
x_1 (si'o/du'u/nu) is hypothetical / is assumed for the sake of analysis by x_2
See {da'i}, {xanri}, {xa'i}, {da'inpei}

dai'o

experimental cmavo
DAhO
discursive & gafyzmico: reset/restore all defaults (permanently) to discourse-exterior specification; cancel all following discourse-interior default assignments
Any modification made to the default value of all terbri is hereby cancelled and the definitions of all words (with respect to default specifications for terbri), as they explicitly appear in official Lojban word lists and other resources, is hereby used. Permanent until future alterations (with respect to terbri default specifications) is explicitly made. See also: {do'ai}, {zmico}, {gafyzmico}, {da'o}.

dairmoni

fu'ivla
x_1 is a daemon/familiar spirit of type/mythology x_2
Not necessarily evil; for that use {dermoni} or {pacru'i}. See {angeli}, {crida}, {di'albo}, {pruxi}

daiske

lujvo
s1 (mass of facts) is physical/material science of/about subject matter s2 based on methodology s3; s1 is physics.

-dak-
x_1 is a knife (tool) for cutting x_2, with blade of material x_3.
See also {denci}, {balre}, {katna}, {tunta}, {forca}, {smuci}, {kinli}.

x_1 is a sack/bag with contents x_2, and of material x_3.
See also {daski} for pouch, {bakfu}.

daklytcati

dakrmatcete

fu'ivla
x_1 is a machete with blade of material x_2.

dakyba'e

lujvo
b_1 is the blade of knife b_2=d_1.

dakyxa'i

lujvo
x_1=d_1 is a dagger / knife weapon for use against x_2=d_2 by x_3 with blade of material d_3.
Cf. {dakfu}, {xarci}, {cladakyxa'i}, {damba}, {catra}, {zekri}.

dalcange

lujvo
c_1 is a ranch at c_2, of rancher c_3 raising animals c_4=d_1.
Cf. {danlu}, {cange}, {jipci}, {bakni}, {xarju}, {ladru}, {sovda}.

dalcnita

lujvo
c1 is ventrally oriented/is placed ventral relative to c2 of animal d1=c3
x1 is more ventral than x2. Ventral: The abdominal (belly) side. Downwards in most animals, forwards in humans.

dalcrane

lujvo
c1 is anterior oriented/is rostral relative to c2 of animal d1=c3
x1 is more anterior than x2 is. Anterior: Oriented towards the head/direction of locomotion. In most animals, this is forward. In humans, this is up.

dalgapru

lujvo
g1 is dorsally oriented/is placed dorsal relative to g2 of animal d1=g3
x1 is closer to the dorsal side than x2 is. Dorsal: oriented towards the back (up in most animals, backways in humans). See gapru, dalcnita, dalcrane, daltrixe

dalgeko

fu'ivla
x_1 is a gecko lizard of species x_2
See also: {danlu}, {respa}, {spaigopodidai}

dalgunma

lujvo
x_1 is a flock/pride/herd of animals x_2

dalkastora

fu'ivla
x_1 is a beaver (genus Castor) of taxon x_2
See also {lalxu}, {mudri}, {danlu}

dalko'ala

fu'ivla
x_1 is koala of species/subspecies x_2
See also {kanguru}

dalku'i

lujvo
k_1 a herder/takes-care-of/attends to//is caretaker for animals k_2=d_1.

dalmikce

lujvo
m_1 is a doctor for animal m_2=d_1 of species d_2 for ailment m_3 using treatment m_4.

dalmustela

fu'ivla
x_1 is a weasel / ferret / European polecat / fitch (genus Mustela) of taxon x_2

dalpe'o

lujvo
p_1=d_1 is a pet belonging to p_2 of species d_2.
Cf. {danlu}, {pendo}.

dalpe'odja

lujvo
c_1 is pet food for pet c_2=d_1=p_1.
See also animal feed (={da'udja}).

dalpurdi

lujvo
p_1 is a zoo of community/organization p_2 with animals p_3=d_1.
See also: {mivdalmuzga}.

dalrodente

fu'ivla

See also {ratcu}

dalsauia

fu'ivla
x_1 is a guinea pig of species x_2
See also {ratcu}.

dalske

lujvo
s_1 is zoology concerned with animals of type d_2 based on methodology s_3.
Cf. {ji'eske}, {mivdalmuzga}, {mrodalmuzga}, {spaske}.

daltrixe

lujvo
t1 is posterior /is placed caudal relative to t2 of animal/species d1=g3
x1 is more posterior than x2. Posteior: Towards the anus/opposite the typical direction of locomotion. In most animals, it's behind. In humans, it's down

daltsi

lujvo
x_1 is an egg of animal x_2, belonging to species x_3
See {tsiju}

-da'a-

Use x_3 tu'a for fight over an object/objective. See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

lujvo
t_1 is a chimney made of of material t_2 for emitting/expelling smoke/gas/steam/magma t_3=d_1 from source d_2.

damva'u

not necessarily tobacco. Cf. {danmo}, {vasxu}. See also {tankyva'u}, {sigva'u}, {marnyva'u}.

Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

(cf. {ciksi}, {frati}, {preti}, {nabmi}, {spuda} for agentive response/reply, {cpedu})

dansrbuga

fu'ivla

Bugg is a common dance style in Sweden and is very popular on the dancefloors, when dansbands play. Dansband (=lo se dansrbuga {zgibe'e}). Dansband music (=lo se dansrbuga zgike).

dansrcerxi

fu'ivla

Raqs sharqi (Arabic: رقص شرقي‎ [ˈɾˤɑʔsˤe ˈʃæɾʔi]; literally "eastern/oriental dancing") is the style of "Oriental Dance, Egyptian Dance, Arabic" dance more familiar to Westerners, performed in restaurants and cabarets around the world.

In Polish, this musical form is called "mazurek"—a word derived from "mazur," which up to the nineteenth century denoted an inhabitant of Poland's Mazovia region.

danti

da'o

cmavo
DAhO
discursive: cancel pro-sumti/pro-bridi assignments.

da'oi

experimental cmavo
DOI
attitudinal attribution
Whereas {dai} simply marks an attitudinal as applying to someone other than the speaker, da'oi explicitly attributes the preceding attitudinal. In particular, dai is equivalent to da'oi na'e bo mi.
